title: 中國消息：特朗普成立國家審查中心    凡在微博微信上罵過美國的一律拒簽

replies.msg:
2018年2月6日，美國總統特朗普簽署了一項國家安全備忘錄，要求相關部門建立一個國家審查中心，進一步加強篩查想要進入美國的移民和旅行者。

美國國土安全部規定，正式要求赴美簽證申請人向美國政府提交本人過往5年社交媒體記錄。對中國申請人來說就是微博和微信內容。凡在微博、微信上有過威脅美國國家安全或民主自由價值言論的申請人，他們的赴美留學、商務、旅遊簽證或將被拒。

白宮聲明指出，“國家審查中心”的工作就是確定“那些對國家安全、邊境安全、國土安全和公共安全構成威脅的個體”。

國土安全部部長尼爾森在一份聲明中說，作為總統提高全球安全保障和保護美國人努力的一部分，我們已經準備到位，對所有尋求進入美國的個體進行更嚴格的審查。國家審查中心將會支援國土安全部和整個情報界所做的前所未有的工作，防止恐怖分子、暴力犯罪分子和其他危險個體到達我們的海岸。

http://bbs.tianya.cn/m/post-333-1296100-1.shtml

https://www.dhs.gov/news/2018/02/06/secretary-kirstjen-m-nielsen-statement-national-vetting-center

嚴審移民與旅客 川普宣佈成立“國家審查中心”

川普總統簽署總統備忘錄，將成立“國家審查中心”，嚴審來到美國的移民與旅客，包括免簽旅客。川普總統2月6號星期二下午3點40分，在白宮簽署了一個總統備忘錄，責成國土安全部﹑司法部﹑國務院以及其他情報部門一起合作，以六個月的時間，成立一個“國家審查中心”(National Vetting Center)，來審查想進入美國的移民還有旅客。

川普總統之前一直強調要對外來者進行“極嚴審查”(Extreme vetting)，目前還不清楚“國家審查中心”將以何種標準來審查移民與觀光客。目前美國海關官員有可能抽查旅客的電子設備，例如要求他們打開電腦或手機，讓移民官審查當中的內容或旅客的社交媒體;即使是使用中文的社交媒體如微信等等，也會有懂中文的移民官員來審查。

在備忘錄當中並沒有說明審查的標準會有多嚴格，只說將由各部會共同研擬。這個“國家審查中心”，將會有一名由國土安全部長指派的主任，副主任將由國務卿與司法部長指派。

根據備忘錄，受影響的人包括想要進入美國的申請美國簽證者，申請美國免簽計劃者，或其他移民福利者，或移民保護計劃者。

川普：我們需要那道牆

簽署備忘錄的過程不對傳媒公開，不過川普總統在與安全官員和執法人員會面談論MS-13幫派份子問題時提到移民問題，並強調一定要蓋美墨高牆。

他說﹕“我們需要更加好的邊境機制，更加好的邊境安全，而且我們需要那道牆，我們將會得到那道牆。沒有那道牆，我們永遠無法解決這個問題。”

川普總統原本說蓋這道牆墨西哥會出錢，但墨西哥多次否認會出錢。川普之後向國會要180億美元的預算，今年又增加為250億美元。

此前已經因為移民法案的糾葛而導致政府關門，本星期四2月8號又再度面臨聯邦政府關門危機。川普總統今天說，他要的移民法案是結束綠卡抽籤，終止鏈式移民，蓋美墨高牆，而他願意讓180萬在“童年抵達者暫緩遣返計劃”的夢想生成為美國公民。不過如果國會的移民法案不是他所要的，川普總統說“樂意看到政府關門”。

在美國時間星期二下午的白宮記者會上，白宮發言人桑德斯說，川普總統希望看到一個長達兩年的預算案，至於如果當中與移民有關的部分若不合他的意思，是否寧願看到政府關門？桑德斯則不願回答。

雖然係Old News﹕

U.S. to Collect Social Media Data on All Immigrants Entering Country

https://www.nytimes.com/2017/09/28/us/politics/immigrants-social-media-trump.html

WASHINGTON — The Department of Homeland Security will soon begin collecting social media data from all immigrants entering the United States, part of what agency officials call an effort to more effectively screen those coming to the country but privacy advocates see as an unnecessary intrusion that would do little to protect national security.

The department will begin collecting the information on Oct. 18, the same day the Trump administration’s new travel ban on citizens of seven countries and restrictions on those from two others are set to take effect.

Green card holders and naturalized citizens will also have their social media information collected, with the data becoming part of their immigration file. It was unclear whether the monitoring would take place only in the application process or could continue afterward.

The department published the new requirement in the Federal Register last week, saying it would collect “social media handles, aliases, associated identifiable information and search results,” which would be included in an applicant’s immigration file. It said the data would come from “publicly available information obtained from the internet, public records, public institutions, interviewees, commercial data providers.”

The data collection has alarmed privacy groups and lawyers, who expressed concerns on about how the department would use the information. Advocates say they also worry that the monitoring could suck in information on American citizens who communicate over social media with immigrants.

quote.msg:
雖然係Old News﹕

U.S. to Collect Social Media Data on All Immigrants Entering Country

https://www.nytimes.com/2017/09/28/us/politics/immigrants-social-media-trump.html

WASHINGTON — The Department of Homeland Security will soon begin collecting social media data from all immigrants entering the United States, part of what agency officials call an effort to more effectively screen those coming to the country but privacy advocates see as an unnecessary intrusion that would do little to protect national security.

The department will begin collecting the information on Oct. 18, the same day the Trump administration’s new travel ban on citizens of seven countries and restrictions on those from two others are set to take effect.

Green card holders and naturalized citizens will also have their social media information collected, with the data becoming part of their immigration file. It was unclear whether the monitoring would take place only in the application process or could continue afterward.

The department published the new requirement in the Federal Register last week, saying it would collect “social media handles, aliases, associated identifiable information and search results,” which would be included in an applicant’s immigration file. It said the data would come from “publicly available information obtained from the internet, public records, public institutions, interviewees, commercial data providers.”

The data collection has alarmed privacy groups and lawyers, who expressed concerns on about how the department would use the information. Advocates say they also worry that the monitoring could suck in information on American citizens who communicate over social media with immigrants.

replies.msg:
https://www.dhs.gov/news/2018/02/06/national-vetting-center

Release Date: February 6, 2018

On February 6, 2017, President Donald J. Trump signed a National Security Presidential Memorandum to establish a National Vetting Center (NVC), which will be led by the Department of Homeland Security. The NVC will coordinate the efforts of Federal officials to vet people seeking to enter or remain within our country. It will help fulfill President Donald J. Trump’s requirement that departments and agencies improve their coordination and use of intelligence and other information to identify potential threats to national security, border security, homeland security, and public safety.


U.S. to Collect Social Media Data on All Immigrants Entering Country
